Enjoy your stay.

When was the last time you saw a group of Chinese tourists on their way to Disney World and not a single one of them had a camera?
Sir, I have an IBIS hit on six.
All right, mr Navorsky, we would like for you to wait right here, please.
What exactly are you doing in the US, mr Navorsky?
Yellow taxicab, please. Take me to Ramada Inn, 161 Lexington.
Staying at the Ramada Inn?
Keep the change.
I'm gonna need to see your return ticket, please.
I'm going to need the passport also.
Sorry to keep you waiting.
I'm Frank Dixon, I'm the Director of Customers and Border Protection here at JFK. Which means that I help people with thier immigration problems.
Now, uh, we're looking for an interpreter for you. How are we doing on that? Do we have an interpreter?
I understand that you speak a little English.
Yes.
Oh, you do? Okay.
Good. I hope you don't mind if I eat while we talk.
I've a bit of bad news.
It seems that your country has suspended all traveling privileges on passport that have been issued by your government.
And our State Department has revoked the visa that was going to allow you to enter the US.
That's it in a nutshell, basically, right?
Anyway, it seems that while you were in the air, there was a military coup in your country.
Now, most of the dead were members of the President Guard.
They were attacked in the middle of the night.
There was a terrible firefight.
!!! Anyway, there were (very few)(очень мало) civilian casualties. I'm sure your family's fine.
Mr Navorsky, your country was annexed from the inside.
The Republic of Krakozhia is under new leadership.
I don't think he gets it.
So all the flights in and out of your country have been suspended indefinitely.
And the new government has sealed all the borders, which means that your passport and visa are no longer valid.

Great work! Let's make this a bit harder...
